Main Decision Function for Parallel Processing

Source: R/smart_parallel_switching.R
should_use_parallel.Rd

Makes the primary decision about whether to use parallel or sequential processing based on comprehensive analysis of problem characteristics, system resources, and performance estimates.

Usage

should_use_parallel(
  n_combinations,
  matrix_size,
  n_bootstrap = 50,
  user_preference = "auto",
  system_resources = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

n_combinations

Number of parameter combinations to evaluate.

matrix_size

Size of the mobility matrix (n x n).

n_bootstrap

Number of bootstrap samples for stability assessment.

user_preference

User's explicit preference: "auto", "parallel", "sequential".

system_resources

Pre-computed system resources (optional, will detect if NULL).

verbose

Logical indicating whether to display decision reasoning.

Value

List containing the parallelization decision:

use_parallel

Logical indicating whether to use parallel processing

n_cores

Recommended number of cores (if parallel)

reasoning

Text explanation of the decision

performance_estimates

Detailed performance predictions

system_info

System resource information used

user_override

Whether user preference overrode recommendation

Details

The decision process considers: 1. User preferences (explicit overrides) 2. Problem size thresholds (minimum viable parallel work) 3. Resource availability (cores, memory, packages) 4. Performance estimates (speedup, efficiency) 5. Platform-specific considerations

Decision thresholds: - Minimum 8 parameter combinations for parallel consideration - Matrix size >= 15 for meaningful parallel work - At least 2 cores available with required packages - Expected speedup > 1.3x - Parallel efficiency > 40

See also

detect_system_resources, estimate_parallel_benefit, get_optimal_cores

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Automatic decision making
decision <- should_use_parallel(
  n_combinations = 50,
  matrix_size = 100,
  n_bootstrap = 30,
  user_preference = "auto",
  verbose = TRUE
)

if (decision$use_parallel) {
  cat("Using", decision$n_cores, "cores for parallel processing\n")
} else {
  cat("Using sequential processing\n")
}

# Force parallel processing
decision_forced <- should_use_parallel(
  n_combinations = 10,
  matrix_size = 20,
  user_preference = "parallel"
)
} # }
